title: Frequently Asked Questions
subtitle: Find answers to common questions about DanceTwin

items.question: Is my video uploaded anywhere?
items.answer: No! All processing happens directly in your browser using WebAssembly. Your webcam feed is never recorded or sent to any server. The video frames are processed in real-time and immediately discarded.

items.question: Do you collect any personal data?
items.answer: We don't collect any personal data. DanceTwin doesn't require login, doesn't track usage, and doesn't store any information about you or your dance sessions.

items.question: What browsers are supported?
items.answer: DanceTwin works best on modern browsers like Chrome, Edge, or Firefox (latest versions). Safari is supported but may have reduced performance. We recommend Chrome for the best experience.

items.question: Why does the app need camera permission?
items.answer: Camera access is required to capture your dance movements for real-time comparison with the teacher video. The camera feed is only used locally and is never recorded or transmitted.

items.question: Can I use this on mobile?
items.answer: DanceTwin is optimized for desktop browsers where you can position your device to capture full-body movements. Mobile support is limited due to camera positioning challenges.

items.question: How is the score calculated?
items.answer: Your score is based on comparing joint angles between you and the teacher. We analyze arms (35%), legs (40%), and torso (25%). Higher scores mean your poses more closely match the teacher.

items.question: Why is my score low even when I think I'm matching?
items.answer: Common reasons include: timing differences (you might be slightly ahead or behind), angle precision (small differences add up), or visibility issues (some body parts may not be clearly detected).

items.question: What do the celebration effects mean?
items.answer: Perfect (90+): You nailed it! Excellent (85-89): Almost perfect! Good (80-84): Great progress! These celebrations appear when you're doing well to keep you motivated.

items.question: What video formats are supported?
items.answer: We support MP4, WebM, and MOV video formats. For best results, use videos with clear, full-body movements and good lighting.

items.question: How should I position my camera?
items.answer: Position your camera to capture your full body from head to toe. Stand about 2-3 meters away. Make sure the area is well-lit and your background is relatively clear.

items.question: What is mirror mode?
items.answer: Mirror mode flips your camera feed horizontally, like looking in a mirror. This makes it easier to follow along when the teacher is facing you.

items.question: The pose detection isn't working well. What can I do?
items.answer: Try improving lighting, wearing clothes that contrast with your background, and ensuring your full body is visible. Avoid loose or baggy clothing that can obscure body shape.
